words.defineEn: recently started to develop, thus not complete
words.defineVi: gần đây đã bắt đầu phát triển, do đó không hoàn thành

examples: He has an auspicious birth.
for being here on this auspicious occasion.
However they had a less than auspicious start.
words.defineEn: indicating that something is very likely to succeed in the future
words.defineVi: chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó rất có khả năng thành công trong tương lai

examples: The blue uniform sat well on his big frame.
The police officer wears a uniform and a badge.
Often shown in a rumpled uniform and with a five-o'clock shadow on their jowls, these men appear as they fought their war.
I'd love to go have a beer with you, but as you can see by the uniform I'm wearing, I'm actually on the clock right now.
The swabs are issued uniforms.
The attack was the country's darkest hour, but it also served as a galvanizing force that unified the entire population like never before.
Unify this country.
In the 19th century, James Clerk Maxwell finally unified electricity and magnetism.
Switching the iPhone to USB-C would unify their products.
So we're in the unified protect dashboard.
words.defineVi: để trở thành toàn bộ hoặc thống nhất

examples: A period of peace followed the unification of England and Scotland.
Mathematical string theories suggest descriptions of this unification, in addition to a fundamental structure for sub-atomic quarks and electrons.
So when we in the present look at Bismarck in the past and the unification of Germany, it all feels, like, extraordinarily strategic.
Well, by the 1850s, romantic dreams of national unification and the rule of the people gave way to what is known as realpolitik or power politics or realism in politics.
These women supported Giuseppe Mazzini, who wanted national unification and a republican form of government.
words.defineEn: an occurrence that involves the production of a union
words.defineVi: một sự xuất hiện liên quan đến việc sản xuất của một công đoàn

examples: This only served to complicate the situation further.
That one little word has complicated so many lives.
De Beauvoir’s legacy is further complicated by accusations of sexual misconduct by two of her university students.
New questions around AstraZeneca complicate global efforts to deliver inoculations.
This gap complicates the issue of when flying insects first appeared.
The project manager reminded the team that cutting corners would only lead to delays and complications, saying that 'fool's haste is no speed' and urging them to follow established procedures.

The doctor advised his patient to follow the recommended treatment plan, saying that the longest way round is the nearest way home and that taking shortcuts could lead to more health complications in the future.
Serious complications occur rarely.
Maybe you had horrible complications.
His uncle Ahmed Arja died from COVID-19 complications within 10 days.
words.defineEn: the act or process of complicating
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình làm phức tạp

words.defineEn: of or relating to a magistrate
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến một thẩm phán

examples: Ruminants are cows, goats, sheep, anything that chews it's cud.
Some animals, like ruminants and other animals with multiple stomachs, like hippos, have bacteria in their guts that produce this key nutrient.
As ruminants, they have the ability to ferment plant material in their specialized stomachs, which allows them to live off a diet that would be way too fibrous for most creatures.
You’d expect that other ruminants would have similar dietary needs, and therefore might also snack on the occasional bone.
It may be that, like their distant ruminant relatives, they use meaty snacks as nutritional supplements.
words.defineEn: describing an animal that has a stomach with four compartments and chews cud as part of its digestion process
words.defineVi: mô tả một con vật có dạ dày bốn ngăn và nhai lại như một phần của quá trình tiêu hóa

examples: The psychological term for this is ruminate.
and then we ruminate on that forever
A lot of times we will ruminate on bad things, because we're just in a bad mood.
They just sort of catastrophize and ruminate.
You tend to ruminate over the scary prospect of being isolated.
words.defineVi: phản ánh sâu sắc về một chủ đề

examples: Cease and desist!
My message to the Proud Boys and every other white supremacist group is, cease and desist.
Tesla sent me a cease and desist.

We were confident that Mr. Bortnikov relayed the information that I did to Mr. Putin, but similarly, just the way I didn’t want to pass up an opportunity with occasion with Bortnikov, I think the president wanted to make sure that Mr. Putin understood the gravity of this, the seriousness with which President Obama viewed it, and the need to cease and desist.

We had talked about the importance of making sure that President Obama seized that opportunity, so that Mr. Putin understood the gravity of this, the seriousness with which Mr., President Obama viewed it, and the need to cease and desist.
words.defineEn: to stop doing something, particularly in response to a request, command, or understanding that it should be discontinued
words.defineVi: để ngừng làm một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là để đáp lại một yêu cầu, mệnh lệnh hoặc hiểu rằng nó nên được ngừng lại

examples: By the 1930s United Fruit was the largest landholder in Guatemala.
words.defineEn: a holder or proprietor of land
words.defineVi: một chủ sở hữu hoặc chủ sở hữu của đất

examples: He sued the pants off his landlord.
The landlord finally made some repairs in the apartment, but it was only after several complaints and threats of legal action, and a forced kindness deserves no thanks.
Previously estate agents ended up as a monkey in the middle between landlord and tenant.
Carter said she wouldn't pay one red cent of her rent until the landlord fixed her roof.
The landlord was firm that rent must be paid on time, without any ifs, ands, or buts.
words.defineEn: a person or a company who rents a room, house, building, etc. to someone else
words.defineVi: một người hoặc một công ty cho người khác thuê phòng, nhà, tòa nhà, v.v.

examples: Asian landscapes range from breathtaking mountains to stunning beaches.
The old painting depicted a picturesque landscape from a bygone era.
The snowy landscape looked magical under the moonlight.
The full moon cast a soft glow on the landscape.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
words.defineEn: a beautiful scene in the countryside that can be seen in one particular view
words.defineVi: một cảnh đẹp ở vùng nông thôn có thể được nhìn thấy trong một góc nhìn cụ thể
